conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs to determine when objects meet by finding intersection of distance-time graphs.
Velocity-time graphs: Object A starts at zero velocity and increases linearly; Object B starts at higher velocity and decreases linearly.
Convert velocity-time graphs into distance-time graphs; area under graph represents distance.
Object A's distance-time graph is a trapezoid representing distance traveled over time.
Object B's distance-time graph is a trapezoid representing distance traveled over time.
Objects meet when distances traveled are equal; find intersection of trapezoidal areas.
Intersection occurs at time \( t_2 \), where distances are equal.
Verify distances are equal at \( t_2 \) and both objects move in same direction.
The two objects meet at time \( t_2 \).
